alert.note: Alert for Marquette (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 12 at 10:26AM EDT until April 18 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Marquette MI has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Michigan... East Branch Escanaba River at Gwinn affecting Marquette County. Middle Branch Escanaba River at Humboldt affecting Marquette County. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING TO TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Middle Branch Escanaba River at Humboldt. * WHEN...From Friday evening to Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 6.5 feet, County Road FX begins to flood * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM EDT Wednesday the stage was 4.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Friday evening to a crest of 7.0 feet early Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 6.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.9 feet on 04/25/2022. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/marquette. The next statement will be issued by late tonight at 230 AM EDT.
